title: 唔可以就咁算！追討天水圍女示威者被扯甩褲事件！ 一齊DM Emma Watson

replies.msg:
小妹不才，第一次開post，唔講廢話，啱用嘅就copy and paste send爆emma watson inbox，記得send埋圖。歡迎修改。知機會好微，不過如果佢一夜之間收到10000個講同一件事嘅dm，可能會肯發聲。

Hello Emma,

We're writing to express concern over an incident involving the violation of female rights that has just happened in Hong Kong. As you may have noticed, Hong Kongers are currently experiencing police brutality on a daily basis during the process of fighting aginst the extradition bill imposed by the HK government. Earlier just now a female protestor was arrested near a local police station, during which her pants were violently ripped off against her will. The police officers made no attempt to protect her privacy which was unacceptable on any level. Since the beginning of the protests in June not one of our local feminist organizations have stood out for female rights.

We are in desperate times and sincerely seek your help in raising international concern over this matter as we can foresee more inicidents like this one are going to happen in the near future if nothing is done to stop poice brutality. Thanks a lot for your time!

A group of concerned Hong Kongers

文已改
—
Dear Emma,

We are writing to express concern over an incident of sexual violence during the protest happened in Hong Kong. You may have noticed that Hong Kongers are currently experiencing police brutality while fighting against the extradition bill imposed by the HK government. Few hours ago, a female protestor was arrested near a local police station. Her pants and her underwear were ripped off. The police officers made no attempt to let her re-wear her pants. The public insult to that female protester, aims to threaten other women not to join the future protests. It is unacceptable in any level as her right to her body is being violated.

We are sincerely seek your help in raising international concern over this matter. We may foresee more similar incidents in the near future if not to stop the excessive force by the police. Thank you for your attention.

Best regards,
A group of concerned Hong Kongers

Dear XXXX

We're writing to express concern over an incident involving the violation of female's rights that has just happened in Hong Kong. As you may have noticed, Hong Kongers are currently experiencing police brutality on a daily basis during the process of fighting aginst the extradition bill imposed by the HK government.

In 2015, a female protestor was found guilty with "battery against a police officer" with her beast.1

Earlier just now a female protester was arrested near a local police station, during which her pants were violently ripped off against her will. (The troubling images of how the police treat the female protestor are attached in this email,2,3). The police officers made no attempt to protect her privacy which was unacceptable on any level. Since the beginning of the protests in June not one of our local feminist organizations have stood out for female rights.

We are in desperate times and sincerely seek your help in raising international concern over this matter as we can foresee more inicidents like this one are going to happen in the near future if nothing is done to stop police brutality. Thanks a lot for your time!

A group of concerned Hong Kongers
__________________________
Appendix

1https://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/law-crime/article/1840630/hong-kong-protester-convicted-assaulting-police-officer-her

2 A female protester's pants were violently ripped off on 5th August, 2019 https://upload.cc/i1/2019/08/05/SOhb8Y.jpeg

3 Various similar serious mistreatment by the Hong Kong Police Force https://na.cx/i/wvJQZq1.png

Dear Emma,

We are writing to express concern over an incident of sexual violence during the protest happened in Hong Kong. You may have noticed that Hong Kongers are currently experiencing police brutality while fighting against the extradition bill imposed by the HK government. Few hours ago, a female protestor was arrested near a local police station. Her pants were ripped off and her underwear also fell off. The police officers made no attempt to let her re-wear her underwear. The public insult to that female protester, aims to threaten other women not to join the future protests. It is unacceptable in any level as her right to her body is being violated.

We sincerely seek your help in raising international concern over this matter. We may foresee more similar incidents in the near future if not to stop the excessive force by the police. Thank you for your attention.

Best regards,
A group of concerned Hong Kongers
